vivecraft.serverSettings.general.message:
Ticks to wait before kicking a player or sending the welcome messages. (20 ticks is 1 second)
 The player's client must send the Vivecraft VERSION info in this time.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.toolti:
Set message to nothing to not send. e.g., leaveMessage = ''
 Use '&player' in any message for the player name.
 For messages that take two placeholders (i.e., death by mob) use '&cause' for the second placeholder.
 When using a placeholder in a message, the message needs to be surrounded by '' to load correctly
vivecraft.serverSettings.climbey.blockli:
List of block names for use with WHITELIST/BLACKLIST block mode.
 Uses Mojang block names, not Spigot materials.
 For 1.12.2 and older these are of the form 'id:data' or 'name:data'
   i.e. 'wool:14' or '35:14'.
 For 1.13+ these are of the form 'namespace:blockid' or just 'blockid'
   i.e. 'minecraft:white_wool' or 'white_wool'
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.checkFo:
What updates to notify for.
 Options are: 'RELEASE', 'BETA', 'ALPHA'
comment2: additional strings that are not in the mod
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.viveCra: Allows crafting of Vivecraft items, like the 'Climbing Claws' or the 'Jump Boots'
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.request: Asks the client for the VR data, if this is disabled no movement data will be shared, and some features will not work.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.sendDat: Send the VR movement data to the clients, if this is disabled clients will not see each others movement.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.kickPla: Kicks players on setting changes, if they don't support updating that setting on the fly. So it forces a rejoin.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.dualW: §6CAUTION!§r When enabling this, also make sure to enable 'allowFasterBlockBreaking', or breaking blocks too fast will still use the main hand item.
vivecraft.serverSettings.setSpigotSettin: When enabled, this will override the listed spigot settings.
Overrides the 'moved-wrongly-threshold' spigot setting, if this is larger.
Overrides the 'moved-too-quickly-multiplier' spigot setting, if this is larger.
vivecraft.serverSettings.permissions.gro: Will assign players to the VR/NonVR groups when they join and have vivecraft installed.
vivecraft.serverSettings.permissions.Non: The group to assign to Vivecraft players that are not in VR.
vivecraft.serverSettings.permissions.VRg: The group to assign to Vivecraft players that are actively in VR.
vivecraft.serverSettings.permissions.cli:
Permission that can be given to allow players to climb on any block.
 This is the same as setting 'climbey.blockmode' to DISABLED just for them.
vivecraft.serverSettings.debug.debugLogg: Will log debug information, like clients that connect with Vivecraft and their Vivecraft version.
vivecraft.serverSettings.debug.particles: Will spawn debug particles to indicate the server state.
Only spawns particles near server operators.
Will spawn particles at VR players device positions, to indicate the server VR data state.
Will spawn particles at VR players head position, to indicate the server VR data state.
Will spawn particles at the corners of the bow head hitbox.
vivecraft.command.usage:
Usage: /%s <option>
accepted options:
- %s <config>: Prints this help, and details to a specified config setting if specified.
- %s: Lists all current players with Vivecraft installed.
- %s: Reloads the config file from disk, overriding any settings currently set.
vivecraft.command.usage.config:
Updating config: /%s <config> <action> <value>
accepted actions:
- %s: Prints the current value.
- %s: Sets the new specified value.
- %s: Resets the config to the default value.
- %s: For the climbey blocklist, to add/remove blocks.
vivecraft.command.needsReload: For this config to take effect a §6server reload§r is required.
vivecraft.command.nonList: '%s' is only applicable to list settings.
vivecraft.command.list.set: List configs cannot be set directly!
vivecraft.command.number.outOfRange: '%s' is out of the valid range [%s,%s] for %s.
vivecraft.command.invalid: '%s' is not a valid value for '%s'.
vivecraft.command.unsupportedClient:
Some clients don't support to toggle this setting and need to rejoin the server for it to update.
 If you would like to automatically kick them on such setting changes, enable '%s'.
vivecraft.setting.kick: A server setting changed that needs you to rejoin the server.
